file_content.text: I need to know something. Do you think you're making a difference?
The citizens of Corellia don't even know you exist. When you die, who will mourn you?
None of your victories matter. You're a desperate insect, clinging to a burning leaf.
Defeating me has accomplished nothing. The reactors are still set for overload.
You slipped past the ray shield. That's unfortunate, but you won't win.
For the Emperor to succeed, the people of Corellia must die. Only then, can this ruined galaxy be redeemed.
We'll discuss this--after I stop those reactors from overloading.
Let me shut down the reactors.
I can't let you do that.
The Emperor has filled your head with lies. Death is not redemption. You know better.
That's him talking, not you.
There is no redemption through peace. The Emperor showed me the truth.
Redeem the galaxy by destroying it? That's insane.
You're a lunatic.
This galaxy isn't worth saving. Every being--every creature--is weak and useless. All except him.
The Emperor is strong. Perfect. Transcending both Sith and Jedi. He will cleanse the stars of our impurity.
The Emperor broke you, Master Braga. Surrender, and I will help you.
That's a lie.
I thought the Emperor was controlling your mind, but you want to do this.
You truly believe that.
The Emperor's thoughts were with me for a long time, but I broke free. And when I did, my eyes were open.
I have seen such horrors. That these things are allowed to exist... it has to end. Here. Now.
Then to follow your logic, I can redeem a fallen Jedi by killing him.
Enough madness. [Attack]
Master Braga, prepare for your redemption.
Ask one of the millions of people I just saved.
I know I am.
The Emperor is controlling you, Master Braga, but not for long. I'm coming to free you.
Let me help you.
You're trapped in old, narrow patterns. You still believe this galaxy is worth saving.
You had more courage as a Jedi. Enough talking. Come out and face me.
Stop hiding, you coward.
This isn't another of your pointless duels. I don't have time to fight you.
In the end, the Emperor wins. This fallen galaxy will be consumed. Purity will be restored.
It isn't the galaxy that's fallen. It's you.
You've gone to the dark side.
My eyes are open. My hand is guided by truth.
The Emperor doesn't care about purification. He wants to destroy this galaxy.
What do you mean, purity?
You can't see they are the same thing.
I'm only making this offer once, Braga. Give up now, or I'll destroy you.
Surrender or die.
A hollow threat. By the time you find me, it will be too late.
One way or another, Corellia dies in flames. And we will all burn together.
Wow. He really knows how to bring down a room.
Let's head back to the science museum. See if that crazy doctor can help us find this guy.
He didn't sound anything like the other fallen Jedi. I have a bad feeling about this.
Maybe Doctor Godera has a lead on Master Braga's location. Let's go find out.
There's more to this than the Emperor. Master Braga is a fanatic. He will never stop.
We must find him before it's too late. Perhaps Doctor Godera has his location.
Reasoning with him isn't an option. Time for Plan B.
I recommend we rendezvous at the science museum and see if Doctor Godera can help us find him.
Master Braga = not himself // Jedi + T7 = find him
Jedi + T7 = return to Doctor Godera?
The Jedi you sent to take over this vessel destroyed their enemies... and themselves. They're all dead, and for what? A starship?
Your Jedi took over a gunnery station, but two of them are dead. Was it worth the sacrifice?
Your Jedi allies fled this vessel and traded one conflict for another. The war is inescapable.
We've got a fight on our hands here. I'll meet you back at base ASAP. Var Suthra out....
